intro: Hemigraphis wetarensis, commonly known as the Weta Island ironwort, is a flowering plant native to the island of Wetar in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves that display a range of colors, including red, purple, and green. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
